quest.name: Welcome to Their Jungle
journal: Montblanc is eager to return to the Prima Vista and report on your findings.
How Montblanc made it back to the tiring room before you did is a mystery best left unsolved.

Despite little chance for success, you contact several of your closest companions and present them with Fran's demands. To your surprise, Hancock replies almost immediately and summons you to the Ruby Bazaar to discuss business.
While Lina seems enthusiastic enough, you, on the other hand, are not as optimistic as the reporter as to how this will all play out.
Bwagi insists that he accompany you to the Ruby Bazaar. It is almost as if he knows something you do not.

For reasons each their own, the East Aldenard Trading Company, the Eorzean Alliance, and Lord Hien all refuse to meet the demands of the Dalmascan resistance. According to Bwagi, however, this is exactly what Fran expected, and the Bangaa says as much before trotting off back to his airship.

Disappointed that your efforts have been for naught, you regroup with your companions to decide a new plan of action. It is at this time the Lady Fran appears, explaining that the leader of Lente's Tears has commanded her to guide you to the Orbonne Monastery. However, before you can depart, Alma is possessed by the Otius and drawn into a dark portal of unknown origin. To save her, you must finally journey to the Golmore Jungle.
Mikoto's device allows Ramza to free his sister from Ultima's portal, but cannot stop Ramza from being swallowed by the magicked rift. Jenomis will not be pleased with the day's results.
Jenomis is in shock at the loss of his only son. There must be some means of saving the boy, but for now, you must wait.
objectives: Speak with Ramza in the tiring room.
Speak with Bwagi down at Kugane Landing.
Speak with Lina Mewrilah near the Ruby Bazaar.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Do not be put off by Lady Fran. The general has quite the edge to her, but it is only because she wants what is best for the resistance.

dialogue.name: GIJUK
dialogue.text: I've finally come to accept Ba'Gamnan is gone for good, but I will never forget how he met his end. I cannot allow my hatred to consume me as it did him.

dialogue.name: RINOK
dialogue.text: Fran is not too bad, once you're on her good side─her only good side being her backside...but you didn't hear that from me.

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: Hurry, hurry! If I don't tell someone of our adventure quick, I'll positively burst, kupo!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: This woman asks much of us...

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: The Viera have ever been wary of outsiders. For centuries their many tribes have remained hidden in the jungles, content with their self-imposed solitude.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Each tribe has its own strict code and will mete swift punishment to any who would defy these laws. As such, many a Viera will spend her entire life bound to the territory of her ancestors, both unwilling and unable to venture beyond its borders.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: And while the tribes are wholly independent, they have agreed to uphold a single standard: shun all contact with the outside world unless it is to protect the jungle.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: That said, with every generation there are those Viera who long for a life beyond the verdant sea of trees and abandon their tribes to start a new life in the kingdom's cities. My guess is that this Fran is one such individual.

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: Who also happens to be the only individual we know who can guide us to the monastery, kupo!

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: It seems Forename's sword arm won't be enough to see us through this predicament. She'llHe'll need to don the right mantle of a diplomat if we're to convince the alliances and the East Aldenard Trading Company to grant us aid. What could go wrong!?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: (-Hancock-)Yes, yes, I know you said not to call unless it was urgent, but this is urgent. All right, not exactly, but my superiors have come to a decision on your request, and I thought you might want to hear what they had to say.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: (-Hancock-)Oh, and let me preempt any request for immediate disclosure with a reminder that the information is much too sensitive to discuss over linkpearl. Meet me at the Ruby Bazaar posthaste and I shall duly apprise you of their judgment.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Well then, Forename. What are we waiting for?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: I've read about how you united the whole of Eorzea under a single standard and convinced the Holy See to end a thousand-year conflict. Compared to that, asking for a few soldiers and a coffer or three of gil should be a piece of rolanberry cake!

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Ah, I suppose we should inform Bwagi down at Kugane Landing of our progress. You mentioned he was to keep an eye on us.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: I've informed Bwagi of our situation. We are ready to make for the Ruby Bazaar when you are.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: So you've an answer from East Aldenard already. Impressive. It would seem the Lady Fran has underestimated your influence amongst the realm's players. I assume you have no objections to me joining you then.

dialogue.name: GIJUK
dialogue.text: Rinok and I will stay here with the airship. Our last foray into the city was met with one too many cold stares for my liking.

dialogue.name: RINOK
dialogue.text: Vessels such as ours require extensive maintenance to remain skyworthy. You and Bwagi take as long as you need.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Whenever you are ready, Forename.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Hancock awaits us in the Bazaar. Shall we, Forename?

dialogue.name: Q3
dialogue.text: Enter the Ruby Bazaar?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: A lovely lady and a...Bangaa? And here I was expecting you would be alone, Forename!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Ah, but excuse my manners. I am Hancock, representative of the East Aldenard Trading Company assigned to oversee her assets here in Kugane. It is a pleasure to meet you.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: And I am Yugiri. We apologize for making you come all this way.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Not that it is far from the landing to─ Ahem.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Bwagi, was it? I serve Lord Hien, rightful ruler of Doma. I have come bearing our nation's reply to your entreaty.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Bwagi, was it? I serve Lord Hien, rightful ruler of Doma. I have come bearing my lord's reply to your entreaty.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: And I am Tataru Taru of the Scions of the Seventh Dawn. I'm only here seeing as no one else could be bothered. Well, that and to bear a message from the leaders of the Eorzean Alliance.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Thank you both for coming. I am Bwagi, formerly of the Dalmascan Royal Fusiliers. I now claim allegiance to Lente's Tears─a resistance group seeking to accomplish what you have in Doma and Ala Mhigo.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: What tidings have you brought us?

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: Allow me to begin then. While the East Aldenard Trading Company sympathizes with your plight, we are not in a position to grant you the funding you seek.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: As you are aware, the East Aldenard Trading Company prides itself in its neutrality, be it in matters political or personal.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: And what of our relationship with the Eorzean Alliance? Ah...yes. What I meant to say was, here in Hingashi, the East Aldenard Trading Company prides itself in its neutrality, be it in matters political and...er...

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: You must understand our position. Simply supplying coin to any one group would make it appear that we somehow favor that group over another. Seeing as we conduct business openly and fairly with everyone, doing such would be sending the wrong message, and ultimately harm profits. Yes.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: And by selling to both sides, you maximize profits while good men and women perish. How convenient!

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: We are a business, milady. We do what we must to survive. That does not mean, however, we are blind to the needs of our customers or our allies, which is why we support the Eorzean Alliance and their noble efforts to safeguard their realm's freedom through a mutually beneficial arrangement.

dialogue.name: HANCOCK
dialogue.text: If it were my choice, I would provide your little resistance with all the funding it needs, but as my good friend, Forename, knows all too well, it is not my choice.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Well, now that Hancock's thoroughly lowered your spirits, you won't be as crestfallen when I inform you the Eorzean Alliance will also be unable to provide any assistance.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: And let me guess, you did everything in your power to try and convince the leaders of each city-state, only to watch as they politely declined our proposal, claiming an unfortunate lack of intelligence or resources.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Wait, how did you─!?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Lord Hien sends his greetings to you and yours. Having recently found strength through a newly formed alliance with our neighboring nations, Doma is open to further welcoming like-minded organizations. This includes our Dalmascan brothers and sisters still suffering under the imperial yoke.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Lord Hien sends his greetings to you and yours, and under normal circumstances would welcome allies still suffering under the imperial yoke.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: However, word has it that the latest attempt at reclaiming your kingdom ended in failure, resulting in the loss of countless lives, including many of the resistance's leaders.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: You are not mistaken. Our army is not what it once was. Those remaining have been forced to take refuge deep beneath the streets of Rabanastre.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: The IVth Legion has already defeated you once. Lacking unity and leadership, the current resistance will not survive another tilt against the Empire's disciplined ranks.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: If Doma is to join hands with Dalmasca as an ally, you must first prove to us that you will stand as one.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Doma as a full-fledged ally would serve far better to strengthening our cause than a few temporary soldiers.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Doma as a full-fledged ally would serve far better to strengthening our cause than a few temporary soldiers.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Yet even if we were able to wrest Dalmasca from the Empire's grasp, without unity amongst your people, the resulting chaos could prove even more perilous to the kingdom.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: You understand much of our situation.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: And based on that understanding, you would refuse your aid to Lente's Tears, am I correct?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: Do not mistake me. Lord Hien's refusal is but a message─a message to help you plan your next step.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: You have a wise master. He understands that without proper planning, driving one enemy from your midst simply creates room for the next.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Lady Fran will no doubt be pleased to hear that your response was exactly what she expected.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: You knew this whole time that your demands would be rejected, yet still you let this farce play out?

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: You have my apologies, but this was all necessary to prove an important point to our leader.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Lady Fran needed to show the princess just exactly what she was getting herself into, and your honesty today will serve us better than any hollow promise. Thank you.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Wait! What about the Golmore Jungle!?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Can you believe this? We're right back to where we started! Principal Jenomis will not be pleased.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: If it is as you say, it is most unfortunate. But, I suppose we did everything in our power, and that is all one could ask.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I still do not understand. Why would Lady Fran send Forename on this wild paissa chase if she knew from the start it would be for naught?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Bwagi mentioned something about Fran proving a point to their leader...whomever that may be.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: People in positions of power can prove both naive and stubborn creatures. Simply telling a leader she is wrong may not convince her of the fact. Seeing one's own plan fail, however, is oft the best medicine.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Naive and stubborn? Then the resistance is doomed!

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: If a person as imposing as Fran is taking orders from her, then chances are this “leader” is even worse, kupo!

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I would not be so certain, Montblanc.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: My guess is that the individual in question is still quite young and inexperienced, and that Lady Fran is trying to teach her to be an effective leader through example.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: By allowing her to make her own mistakes, Fran is granting her the ability to learn and grow from them─an experience that will ultimately benefit her when the time comes to make some truly difficult decisions.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Now, I seem to recall reading that one of the many faces of the resistance before the recent quelling was a young girl of royal blood. Do you suppose─

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: (-???-)You may cease with your baseless presumptions, defector.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: The door was open.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: And you would be?

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: I would be here on orders from the leader of Lente's Tears. Against my better judgment, mind you.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Greetings. Lady Fran, I presume? I am Jenomis cen Lexentale, principal of the Majestic Theater Company. You and your colleagues are most welcome on the Prima Vista.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: What is it your leader would have of us?

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: While you failed in meeting even a single of our demands, she recognizes that you were sincere in your attempts to see them fulfilled, and for that effort, you are to be...compensated.

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: That is most generous.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: The ruins which you seek are hidden behind a waterfall here─a point roughly equidistant from the river's source and its delta.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text:
You have our thanks, Lady Fran. We will not forget this kindness.
Father, I shall plot a course immediately.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Ramza... What is going on here?

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Alma! You should be in bed!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I've slept enough, Brother. Tell me, who are our guests?

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: It appears you once again prepare a leap into danger's maw. Keep your wits about you, Forename. Lady Fran is strong...but then again, so was Ba'Gamnan.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: Ah...if you'll excuse me─

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Are you mad!? A trip to the surface in your condition!?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Listen to me, Brother. The High Seraph beckons. She speaks to me through the Otius.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: The what!?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: There is no need to worry. Mikoto and I have already devised a plan. I can help clear our family name!

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: The Sharlayan has no say in this. I am your father and I insist you remain here on the airship! What would your mother say if I allowed aught to befall you!?

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Mother? That is what this is all about, isn't it!? What it has always been about! You care not about Ivalice or the Orran name. No, you only seek to use the auracite to bring Mother back!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: But you haven't been able to do that. You still do not understand how exactly it is that the shards translate one's desires into reality. That is where I can help. I can ask the High Seraph. It is she who created the auracite.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Ultima has bid me come to her place of imprisonment. If we free her, she will reveal unto us the secrets of her creations!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Do you hear what you are saying, Alma! Even if there was the slightest chance of bringing Mother back, we cannot risk your life in doing so!

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Your brother is right! We have sacrificed too much already! I cannot bear the thought of losing you! Either of you!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: It is too late!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Ominous Voice-)I'm so lonely, Father. Why must you love Ramza more than you do me?

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Do not be cozened by your daughter's words, for they are not her own.

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Help...me...Ramz─

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Alma!!!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: No! No!

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Gods forfend...

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: I told you. No one can control the power within those shards. No one!

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Forename! Here, take this. It might be the only thing that can save Alma, but we must hurry to the monastery!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Come. We leave for the Golmore Jungle...now.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Was the power I sensed beyond the rift─ Was that the High Seraph?

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: What do we do!? What do we do!? We cannot just leave poor Alma to become one of those...one of those...monsters, kupo!

dialogue.name: HURDY
dialogue.text: I think we saw enough to prove that Ultima is no angel, kupo. But if she's not...then what is she!?

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: I've been such a fool...and now I've lost my daughter. Will you ever forgive me, Tia?

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: I cannot believe what I just witnessed... I won't believe it. I won't. There. It didn't happen.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: I have good news and bad news, Forename. The bad news is that it appears the High Seraph was able to employ the Otius as a catalyst to propel her magicks beyond whatever seal she is trapped behind. The good news is, this means my device should function as intended.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: Its design is based off of one of Moenbryda's. It repurposes the logic behind her aetheric siphon into a means of disrupting aetherflow by reversing common wavelengths and─

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: And let us just say it has already been calibrated to match the energy emitted by the Otius. As long as Ultima continues to wield the Otius, we should be able to interfere.

dialogue.name: MIKOTO
dialogue.text: But it only works if we can find Alma. Which is why we must make haste.

dialogue.name: GIJUK
dialogue.text: What happened here? Is everything alright?

dialogue.name: RINOK
dialogue.text: Don't tell me... I can see it in your eyes. The auracite claimed another victim. You were fools to think you'd fare any better than Ba'Gamnan. Fools, all of you.

dialogue.name: BWAGI
dialogue.text: I told her. I told her this was a mistake, and now look what has happened. If you were wise, you'd toss all the remaining shards into Hells' Lid and cut your losses. But you've no more wisdom than Ba'Gamnan. And that's why the High Seraph has already won.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Have I your permission to depart, Forename!? Every moment we tarry here, my sister, she─!

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Of course, Ramza.

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Now is not the best of times.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Then hold on. I've set engines to full speed!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: No, it is the worst of times! I beg of you. Do not ask me to wait any longer. For Alma's sake.

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Welcome to the land of my people. 'Twould be a poor lie if I said I did not miss it some.

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Alma!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Ramza... Help...me...

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Alma!!!

dialogue.name: RAMZALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Begone!

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: Alma! Ramza!

dialogue.name: ALMALEXENTALE
dialogue.text: (-Ominous Voice-)Blood...of the invokers... Fulfill...the ancient covenant...and grant unto me...the vessel...promised.

dialogue.name: LINAMEWRILAH
dialogue.text: What just─!?

dialogue.name: FRAN
dialogue.text: Bwagi, to me! The girl is not well!

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: Uh, might I suggest we continue this back at the Prima Vista, kupo!?

dialogue.name: RAMZABEOULVE
dialogue.text: (-Unknown Voice-)Have you the courage to face true evil?

dialogue.name: MONTBLANC
dialogue.text: What are you gawping at!? The ship is this way, kupo!

dialogue.name: GIJUK
dialogue.text: If you need help finding Ramza, do not hesitate to ask. We are here to help. It is what Ba'Gamnan would have wanted.

dialogue.name: RINOK
dialogue.text: Is the boy's father well? I cannot imagine what he is going through. Losing his daughter, only to lose his son moments after her return...

dialogue.name: JENOMISLEXENTALE
dialogue.text: Now Ramza is gone? Oh, dearest Tia, what have I done? What have I done!?
